intro: Paepalanthus fabianeae, commonly known as the Fabianeae papyrus, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in Brazil. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that collect water, creating a small pool. The plant produces striking red flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. Its unique structure and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
